first_reading.text:
[[Ep 1,1]]Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, to the holy ones who are (in Ephesus) faithful in Christ Jesus:
[[Ep 1,2]]grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
[[Ep 1,3]]Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in Christ with every spiritual blessing in the heavens,
[[Ep 1,4]]as he chose us in him, before the foundation of the world, to be holy and without blemish before him. In love
[[Ep 1,5]]he destined us for adoption to himself through Jesus Christ, in accord with the favor of his will,
[[Ep 1,6]]for the praise of the glory of his grace that he granted us in the beloved.
[[Ep 1,7]]In him we have redemption by his blood, the forgiveness of transgressions, in accord with the riches of his grace
[[Ep 1,8]]that he lavished upon us. In all wisdom and insight,
[[Ep 1,9]]he has made known to us the mystery of his will in accord with his favor that he set forth in him
[[Ep 1,10]]as a plan for the fullness of times, to sum up all things in Christ, in heaven and on earth.
first_reading.title: Letter to the Ephesians

gospel.text:
[[Lc 11,47]]The Lord said: â€œWoe to you! You build the memorials of the prophets whom your ancestors killed.
[[Lc 11,48]]Consequently, you bear witness and give consent to the deeds of your ancestors, for they killed them and you do the building.
[[Lc 11,49]]Therefore, the wisdom of God said, 'I will send to them prophets and apostles; some of them they will kill and persecute'
[[Lc 11,50]]in order that this generation might be charged with the blood of all the prophets shed since the foundation of the world,
[[Lc 11,51]]from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah who died between the altar and the temple building. Yes, I tell you, this generation will be charged with their blood!
[[Lc 11,52]]Woe to you, scholars of the law! You have taken away the key of knowledge. You yourselves did not enter and you stopped those trying to enter."
[[Lc 11,53]]When he left, the scribes and Pharisees began to act with hostility toward him and to interrogate him about many things,
[[Lc 11,54]]for they were plotting to catch him at something he might say.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

psalm.text:
[[Ps 98,1]]Sing to the LORD a new song, 
for he has done wondrous deeds; 
His right hand has won victory for him, 
his holy arm.

[[Ps 98,2]]The LORD has made his salvation known: 
in the sight of the nations he has revealed his justice.
[[Ps 98,3a]]He has remembered his kindness and his faithfulness
[[Ps 98,3b]]toward the house of Israel.

[[Ps 98,3c]]All the ends of the earth have seen
[[Ps 98,3d]]the salvation by our God.
[[Ps 98,4]]Sing joyfully to the LORD, all you lands; 
break into song; sing praise.

[[Ps 98,5]]Sing praise to the LORD with the harp, 
with the harp and melodious song.
[[Ps 98,6]]With trumpets and the sound of the horn 
sing joyfully before the King, the LORD.
psalm.title: Psalms
